description: The CDC said almost 50 people were sickened with E.coli in 10 states after reporting they ate at McDonald's. One person in Colorado died. McDonald's says it believes slivered onions used in the Quarter Pounder and linked to a single supplier may be at fault. It says it is temporarily removing the Quarter Pounder in the affected areas. NBC News' Liz Kreutz reports.
title: Dozens sickened in E. coli outbreak

description: At least 11,500 creative professionals — including Oscar-winning actress Julianne Moore, author James Patterson and musician Thom Yorke — have signed an open letter calling for the prohibition of using human art to train artificial intelligence without permission.
title: More than 11,000 creatives condemn unauthorized use of content for AI development

description: Vice President Kamala Harris talks about sexism, President Biden’s age, and her plans on immigration, abortion and transgender health care, during an interview with NBC News' Hallie Jackson.
title: Kamala Harris full interview: ‘Absolutely’ the country is ready for a woman to be president

description: Prosecutors are facing pressure around payments that Elon Musk's America PAC made to people who signed a petition supporting free speech and gun rights.
title: Pressure is mounting on prosecutors to review Musk’s $1M swing-state petition giveaway

description: NBC News' Vicky Nguyen speaks with Monika Bickert, vice president for content policy at Meta, about new facial recognition tools the social media giant is testing to crack down on scams and fraud.
title: Meta testing new facial recognition technology to help combat scams

description: Meta followed Elon Musk's lead, banning jet-tracking accounts run by Jack Sweeney. The accounts posted locations of jets used by Donald Trump and Taylor Swift.
title: Meta bans jet-tracking accounts that post updates on Trump, Musk and Zuckerberg

description: Losing or not having your sense of smell may be linked to changes in breathing that could lead to depression, social isolation or other mental health problems, a new study suggests.
title: Losing your smell could lead to mental health problems and depression, new study finds

description: Vice President Kamala Harris will sit-down with NBC News anchor Hallie Jackson for an exclusive interview.
title: Early voting begins in Milwaukee; Bruce Springsteen to headline two Harris rallies

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is visiting Israel with hopes that the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar could open a window for new cease-fire talks while also defusing the conflict in Lebanon. Shortly before his arrival, Hezbollah rockets were intercepted over Tel Aviv, underscoring the urgency of the trip. NBC’s Raf Sanchez reports for TODAY.
title: Blinken visits Israel in hopes of new talks after Hamas leader killed

description: As Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris face off in the presidential election, China’s President Xi Jinping has not expressed a preference for either.
title: Who does China’s president want to win the U.S. election?

description: As Republican vice presidential nominee JD Vance campaigns across the country, his wife, Usha Vance, has been a near-constant presence by his side.
title: Usha Vance's expansive reading list gives a glimpse of a private figure in the campaign

description: Israeli officials are weighing an Egyptian proposal for a cease-fire deal with Hamas aimed at trying to build momentum for a larger agreement, an Israeli official told NBC News as Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in the Middle East
title: Israel considering Egyptian plan for 2-week cease-fire with Hamas, source says

description: Harvey Weinstein, the disgraced Hollywood mogul whose alleged sexual misconduct fueled the #MeToo movement and who was recently indicted on new charges, has chronic myeloid leukemia, two sources told NBC News.
title: Harvey Weinstein diagnosed with chronic myeloid leukemia, sources say
